trans-unit.source: Describes the source and destination of a given serialized stream, and provides an additional caller-defined context.
Indicates the source or destination of the bits that the formatter uses.
Classes with surrogates or that implement <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable> can serialize or ignore fields and values based on the information stored in the streaming context.
For example, a window handle is still valid if the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext.State%2A> property is set to `System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContextStates.CrossProcess`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> class with a given context state.

A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContextStates"></xref> values that specify the source or destination context for this <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> class with a given context state, and some additional information.

A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContextStates"></xref> values that specify the source or destination context for this <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref>.
Any additional information to be associated with the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref>.
This information is available to any object that implements <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable"></xref> or any serialization surrogate.
Most users do not need to set this parameter.
Gets context specified as part of the additional context.
Can be `null`.
The context specified as part of the additional context.
Determines whether two <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> instances contain the same values.
Two code groups are equivalent if they have the same <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext.Context%2A> and <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext.State%2A>.
An object to compare with the current instance.
`true` if the specified object is an instance of <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> and equals the value of the current instance; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a hash code of this object.

The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContextStates"></xref> value that contains the source or destination of the serialization for this <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref>.
Gets the source or destination of the transmitted data.
During serialization, the current property specifies the destination of the transmitted data.

For example, when serializing data from cross-AppDomain remoting, the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContextStates> is <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContextStates.CrossProcess>.
During deserialization, the state indicates the source of the deserialized stream.
During serialization, the destination of the transmitted data.
During deserialization, the source of the data.
